title: ✅ Eco-Fascist (091) renamed → Fortress Traditionalist
desc: RESOLVED: Profile (CSO=78, H=73, ZS=75, ONT_S=28) had no ecological dimension. Renamed to Fortress Traditionalist — scarcity-driven authoritarianism, hierarchical traditionalism, siege mentality. Updated across 6 active files in polmodel-final/.

title: Third Way Democrat (068) votes McCain in 2008
desc: PF=70 (strong partisan Democrat) but model picks McCain with 83.7 confidence. Obama wins them in 2012. Likely cause: L5 vote prediction overweights MAT proximity (Obama ~25 vs Third Way's 55) while underweighting partisan identity (PF=70). PF should act as a strong anchor that discounts policy distance for strong partisans.

title: Anti-Politics (097) — is this a real archetype or a measurement artifact?
desc: PF=20, ENG=20, PRO=23, ONT_S=25. Someone who doesn't engage, doesn't identify with parties, and is pessimistic. Votes erratically: Kerry→McCain→Romney→Johnson→Biden→Harris. Question: is this a coherent political disposition or just the absence of one? Does "I don't care about politics" constitute an archetype, or is it what you get when someone scores low on everything salient?
